title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Northeast monsoon conditions are gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Reservoir water levels gradually receding – Irrigation Dept.
byline: The Department of Irrigation has announced that water levels in all reservoirs across the island are returning to normal.

title: Chinese jets point radar at Japanese aircraft, Japan says
byline: Japan said on Sunday that Chinese fighter jets had aimed their radar at Japanese military aircraft in two “dangerous” incidents near Japan’s Okinawa islands, an account Beijing disputed.

title: Two businesses fined Rs. 1 mln each for overpricing bottled water
byline: A court has imposed fines totaling Rs. 1 million each on a holiday resort and a private company for selling bottled drinking water at excessively inflated prices.

title: Hotline introduced to address post-disaster mental health needs
byline: The health sector of Sri Lanka has advised the general public to contact the National Institute of Mental Health, using the hotline 1926 for guidance, if they are experiencing mental stress following the recent disaster.

title: Thai army says air strikes launched along disputed border area with Cambodia
byline: Thailand has launched air strikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, Thai army spokesman Major General Winthai Suvaree said on Monday, after both countries accused the other of breaching a ceasefire agreement.

title: Two suspects arrested with ‘Ice’ on Panamura–Middeniya road
byline: Two suspects have been arrested in possession of crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’) in the Lellawala area along the Panamura–Middeniya road.

title: Wife arrested for clubbing husband to death in Mihintale
byline: A man has died after being struck with a blunt weapon by his wife in the Mahakirindegama area of Mihintale.

title: Renovation work on Colombo–Puttalam railway line underway
byline: The railway line between Kuda Oya and Nattandiya on the Colombo–Puttalam line, which was damaged by recent adverse weather conditions, is undergoing urgent repairs.

title: Restoration of canals damaged due to floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah underway
byline: The Department of Irrigation has taken urgent measures to restore canals and reservoirs damaged by the floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah, aiming to resume water supply to paddy fields and other cultivation lands.

title: IndiGo refunds tickets worth INR 6.1 billion, on-time flight ops improve
byline: IndiGo is on track to operate over 1,650 flights, up from 1,500 yesterday, the airline said in a status update this evening. It said 137 out of 138 destinations are in operation with on-time performance of 75 per cent, up from 30 per cent yesterday.

title: “Not politics, our moral duty”: Namal urges PM to convene Parliament amid flood crisis
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has called on the Prime Minister to convene Parliament immediately to address the ongoing flood and landslide crisis affecting the country.

title: DMC director warns public to avoid visiting disaster-hit areas
byline: The Director of the Disaster Management Center (DMC), Pradeep Kodippili, has warned that visiting disaster-hit areas is extremely dangerous and urged the public to refrain from bathing or entering waters flowing with strong currents.

title: NBRO submits risk mitigation recommendations for Hatton route to Sri Pada
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has submitted a set of recommended measures following an inspection of the landslide-affected area in Mahagiri Damba along the Hatton access route to the Sri Pada (Adam’s Peak) pilgrimage site.

title: AI-powered police body cameras get tested in Canada
byline: Police body cameras equipped with artificial intelligence have been trained to detect the faces of about 7,000 people on a “high risk” watch list in the Canadian city of Edmonton, a live test of whether facial recognition technology shunned as too intrusive could have a place in policing throughout North America.

title: Chinese relief aircraft carrying Rs. 400M worth of aid arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: A consignment of humanitarian aid worth around Rs. 400 million, donated by China for the disaster-affected population in Sri Lanka, arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this morning (08) aboard a Chinese cargo aircraft.

title: The Lord of the Rings trilogy returns to theaters in January for 25th anniversary
byline: One does not simply spend more than 11 hours watching The Lord of the Rings trilogy in a single weekend at home when the opportunity to do so in theaters arises.

title: Special programme launched to clear post-flood waste in Biyagama
byline: A special program has been initiated to remove the garbage and debris that had accumulated in the Biyagama area following the recent floods caused by adverse weather conditions.

title: Water leak in Louvre damages hundreds of books
byline: A water leak at the Louvre museum in Paris has damaged hundreds of works, just weeks after thieves stole priceless French crown jewels from the museum in broad daylight.

title: Telangana to name Hyderabad road after Donald Trump, BJP reacts
byline: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy has proposed naming a primary road in Hyderabad after US President Donald Trump - a move apparently aimed at grabbing global attention ahead of “Telangana Rising Global Summit” - an international event the state is looking forward to.

title: Police uncover two firearms on Polonnaruwa–Batticaloa main road
byline: Two firearms have been taken into police custody near the 20th milepost on the Polonnaruwa–Batticaloa main road within the Valaichchenai Police Division.

title: President calls for report on damaged roads in Nuwara Eliya
byline: A discussion on reviewing the damage caused to the roads in the Nuwara Eliya District and the urgent measures required to repair them was held this morning (08) at the Nuwara Eliya District Secretariat, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Steps taken to promptly provide facilities to Kandy Court complex affected by floods
byline: A decision has been taken to promptly provide all necessary facilities to the Kandy Court Complex that was damaged by recent floods caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Case against British citizen over LPL match-fixing allegations to be taken up in Jan. 2026
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Attorney General against Tamim Rahman, a Bangladeshi national with British citizenship and the owner of the “Dambulla Thunders” franchise, be taken up again on January 7.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces.

title: Jetstar to launch Australia’s only low-cost direct flights to Sri Lanka
byline: Jetstar will take off for the first time from Australia to Sri Lanka in August next year, with the launch of the only direct low-cost service from Melbourne to the South Asian nation’s capital, Colombo.

title: Sri Lanka’s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 635
byline: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 635, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed.

title: Army Chief meets Indian and Pakistani personnel engaged in rescue and relief operations
byline: The Commander of the Army, Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo conducted a field visit to Mahiyanganaya to inspect communities affected by the recent severe weather conditions, including heavy rainfall, flooding, and landslides, the Sri Lanka Army said in a statement.

title: 25% reduction in vegetable harvest in Nuwara Eliya due to adverse weather
byline: A special District Coordinating Committee meeting, convened today (08), to review the damage caused to the agricultural sector in the Nuwara Eliya District due to Cyclone Ditwah and to discuss the urgent measures required at the Nuwara Eliya District Secretariat.

title: Highest volume of water in history entered Kotmale Reservoir on Nov. 27 – Officials
byline: The highest volume of water in history entered the Kotmale Reservoir on November 27 and that the spill gates were opened scientifically according to the standard procedure in order to protect the Kotmale Dam, officials have stated.

title: Police requests public assistance to prevent damage to exposed telecom cables
byline: Sri Lanka Police stated that a telecommunications service provider has requested the Inspector General of Police (IGP) to inform the public about the risk of damage to telecommunication cables that have been exposed in several areas due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: High-level committee appointed to oversee coordination of foreign flood aid
byline: A high-level national committee has been appointed to ensure the proper coordination and distribution of foreign humanitarian aid received for the population affected by the recent flood disaster in Sri Lanka.

title: US mulls rejecting visas for fact-checkers and content moderators
byline: The Donald Trump administration has directed US embassy officials to reject visa applicants who have worked in roles related to fact-checking, content moderation, compliance, or online safety, according to a State Department memo obtained by Reuters.

title: Govt seeks information on industries affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development has issued a notice regarding the Rs. 200,000 grant provided by the government to restore industries affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Tsunami warning issued for Japan’s east coast after 7.6-magnitude earthquake
byline: A tsunami warning has been issued for parts of Japan’s east coast after a magnitude-7.6 earthquake struck off the coastline, according to Japan’s Meteorological Agency.

title: Pakistan sends 7.5 tons of additional relief supplies to Sri Lanka
byline: Pakistan has dispatched an additional 7.5 tons of humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka following widespread destruction caused by Cyclone Ditwah, the National Disaster Management Authority said in a statement.

title: 20 MT food aid from Australia and WFP arrives to support cyclone-affected communities
byline: The World Food Programme (WFP), in partnership with the Government of Australia, has dispatched a consignment of 20 metric tonnes of high-energy fortified biscuits to support communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Govt prioritises rapid relief delivery to restore normalcy in disaster-hit Kandy: PM Harini
byline: In order to restore people’s lives back to normalcy, the government will provide necessary relief and assistance, and that the effective cooperation of officials at the divisional level is important to ensure that essential relief reaches the public promptly, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Yasantha Kodagoda sworn in as Acting Chief Justice of Sri Lanka
byline: Justice Yasantha Kodagoda has been sworn in as the Acting Chief Justice of Sri Lanka.

title: Govt hoping to restore public transport services by Dec. 31 – Minister
byline: The government is hoping to restore public transport services by December 31, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake has announced.

title: Level-3 landslide warning issued to several areas in four districts extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued to multiple areas in four districts has been extended.

title: Retired Government Analyst’s Department officer arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: A retired officer of the Government Analyst’s Department has been taken into custody on charges of accepting bribes.

title: ‘Help us build climate-resilient infrastructure’ – President urges Sri Lanka’s partners
byline: Sri Lanka is struggling to recover from the devastating Cyclone Ditwah even as it was trying to rebuild from a debt crisis and political turmoil, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Newsweek in an exclusive interview as he called for a new approach for debt-burdened countries vulnerable to climate change.

title: President inspects Rendapola landslide site
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today (08) visited the Rendapola deadly landslide site in Welimada.

title: PM assures full support to rebuild flood-hit Peradeniya University
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya says the government stands ready to support rebuilding the University of Peradeniya after several of the facilities were damaged in recent floods.

title: Over 100,000 hectares of paddy fields damaged due to adverse weather
byline: Approximately 108,000 hectares of paddy, 6,600 hectares of maize, 6,143 hectares of up-country and low-country vegetables and 11,000 hectares of land used to cultivate other crops have been completely destroyed due to adverse weather conditions experienced in recent days.

title: Politicians obstruct Grama Niladhari officers from independently carrying out relief operations - Union
byline: The Grama Niladhari Officers’ Alliance has threatened to resort to trade union action if Grama Niladhari officers are obstructed from carrying out their duties independently during the relief distribution process for those affected by the disaster.

title: India sends four additional warships to Sri Lanka with 1,000 tons of relief material
byline: The Indian Navy has deployed four more warships to support relief efforts in cyclone-hit regions of Sri Lanka as part of the ongoing Operation Sagar Bandhu, which aims to provide urgent Search & Rescue (SAR) and Humanitarian Assistance & Disaster Relief (HADR) aid.

title: Govt aims to ensure safety and security of every citizen – President
byline: The aim of the government is to ensure a safe life for every citizen and that it is everyone’s responsibility to act with proper supervision during the resettlement of the people, according to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Several people injured after 7.6-magnitude earthquake hits Japan
byline: Several people have sustained injuries at a hotel in the Aomori town of Hachinohe after a powerful 7. 6-magnitude earthquake struck off northern Japan on Monday.

title: Bandaranaike Foundation donates Rs. 250 million towards ongoing recovery efforts
byline: The Bandaranaike Memorial National Foundation has extended a financial contribution of Rs. 250 million towards national recovery efforts following the recent disaster.
